extension.description:
Content Notifier Plugin. Sends email notifications to designated email address(es) when articles are added to or modified in selected categories. .......................................................................................................

Content Notifier Plug-In v2.0

© 2018 Bruce Scherzinger

Allows the site admin to subscribe/unsubscribe one or more email addresses to be notified when an article in selected categories is created or modified.

Special tags you can insert into email notice message fragments are as follows:

TagWhat is InsertedIn Message Parts
[SITE]Name of the website.Subject,Body
[CATEGORY]Category containing the article.Subject,Body
[ACTION]Phrase indicating what just happened to the article. See Plugin SettingsSubject,Body
[TITLE]Article title.Subject,Body
[INTROTEXT]Article intro text.Body (HTML only)
[FULLTEXT]Article full text.Body (HTML only)
[LINK]URL of the article.Body
[ALIAS]Article alias.Body
[CREATED]Article creation date.Body
[MODIFIED]Article modified date.Body
[AREA]Site area where article was saved ("Front" or "Back").Body

One notification will be sent to each group subscribed to the category for each article that changed.

If you wish to be able to select whether each group sends an email based on where the article was saved (site front or back end), you must define two language overrides for PLG_CONTENT_NOTIFIER_AREA as follows:

  • Administrator: "Back"
  • Site: "Front"

If you do not define this, you can only enable subscription groups using the Both option. Front, Back, and Neither options will all disable the group.

field.name: emailsettings
field.label: From Email Settings
field.description: These settings are optional. Leaving them empty will cause the site defaults to be used.

field.name: from_addr
field.label: From Address:
field.description: Email FROM address for sending all notifications.

field.name: from_name
field.label: From Name:
field.description: Email FROM name for sending all notifications.

field.name: actionsettings
field.label: Action Settings
field.description: You can use either a language override or existing constant, or you can just enter your phrases here to define what you want the [ACTION] tag to contain in these cases. If you leave either box empty, the default is COM_CONTENT_SAVE_SUCCESS.

field.name: newaction
field.label: New Article:
field.description: Language constant to use when an article is just created.

field.name: saveaction
field.label: Updated Article:
field.description: Language constant to use when an article is just updated.

field.name: subgroupheading
field.label: Subscription Groups
field.description: Each subscription group has a set of fields. The fields in each row are specific to that group.

field.name: subgroups
field.label: Click + to add groups →
field.description: Clicking the button to the right adds a new group to the end. Clicking the + in the lower right corner of a group box adds a group after that one. Ordering could be relevant, but it is generally not. So using the group drag handles is probably not useful other than to put the group you use most first.
